The query method is used to retrieve data from the database. It takes in a number of parameters, including the table name, the columns to retrieve, the selection criteria, the selection arguments, the group by clause, the having clause, the order by clause, and the limit clause.
The first parameter is a boolean value that indicates whether or not to use a distinct query. If true, the query will return distinct rows, meaning that each row will be unique. If false, the query will return all rows, including duplicates.
The second parameter is the name of the table to query.
The third parameter is an array of strings that specifies the columns to retrieve. If null, all columns will be retrieved.
The fourth parameter is the selection criteria. If null, all rows will be retrieved.
The fifth parameter is an array of strings that specifies the selection arguments. If null, no arguments will be used.
The sixth parameter is the group by clause. If null, no group by clause will be used.
The seventh parameter is the having clause. If null, no having clause will be used.
The eighth parameter is the order by clause. If null, no order by clause will be used.
The ninth parameter is the limit clause. If null, no limit clause will be used.
The query method returns a Cursor object that can be used to iterate over the results of the query. The Cursor object provides methods to move to the next row, get the value of a column, and so on.
